pageContext.claim: “And they say, 'Sir, you can't go after him because he's shielded because he made the speech he totally lied. He made it in Congress and he can say anything.' See, it should be the opposite. When you're in Congress, you should be more honest.”
pageContext.analysis: Members of Congress are only exempt from arrest - with the exceptions of treason, felony and breach of the peace - while Congress in session. Still, lying isn't illegal and so, Congressional immunity is irrelevant to Trump’s claim.
